result.execSummary:
The defendant Nyje R Siller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and school, Good Time Credit

miscConds.notes: Pay mandatory costs, fees and surcharges including DNA, during term of probation. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 379.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- No use or possession of any weapons.
- No further violations of the law.
COURT WILL GRANT EXPUNGEMENT UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION

- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Release for work and school; STAYED; to be used at discretion of Probation Agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nyje R Siller

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Nyje R Siller in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed, but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
Defendant ordered to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, credit of 21 days time served, Huber privileges for work and school, good time credit. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:

- Serve 90 in the House of Correction as a condition time sentence, release for work and school, STAYED, to be used at discretion of Probation Agent. 
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- Obtain HSED or GED.
- 50 hours of community service.
- No use or possession of any weapons. 
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 6 months. 

Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Nyje R Siller in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. State has no objection.  Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Nyje R Siller in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nyje R Siller in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  James C Griffin for Samuel Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pretrial Services Violation Report
missed alternate contact
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Childs, Br. 02.

03:54 PM Defendant Nyje R Siller in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Nyje R Siller in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Leidy. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Nyje R Siller in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Nyje R Siller in custody.  Kaitlyn Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nyje R Siller appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
